alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 11:13PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lincoln County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1112 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beverly, or 8 miles east of Lincoln, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, locally heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincoln, Beverly, Barnard and Westfall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
